page.title: 09 Farming continued.
page.content: 20/30 acres in a day.The wheat is grown for flour,the barley for feeding cattle and making beer and the oats for porridge and feeding the animals. Grass is grown for hay and silage.Hay is dried grass.Silage is wet grass put in a pit after it is rolled by tractor so that no air is in it.Inwinter it is fed to the animals.9tons of silage per cow-70 kilos per sheep. Sheep and beef cows are kept on the hilly land. There are 1,400 sheep who have approximately 2 lambs a year.They are sheared once a year by shearers who come from New Zealand. The soil is a mixture of clay, sand and chalk.The climate tends to be rainy which is good for growing grass.There are 20 tractors on the farm(each using up to 30 gallons of petrol a day) and 4 sheep dogs.
